protocol_num.description: The TCP/IP protocol number, as defined by the Internet Assigned Numbers Authority (IANA). Use -1 if the protocol is not defined by IANA. See Protocol Numbers. For example: 6 for TCP and 17 for UDP.

protocol_ver.caption: Protocol Version
protocol_ver.description: The Protocol version, normalized to the caption of the protocol_ver_id value. In the case of 'Other', it is defined by the event source.

protocol_ver_id.caption: Protocol Version ID
protocol_ver_id.description: The normalized identifier of the Protocol version.

provider.caption: Provider
provider.description: The origin of information associated with the event. See specific usage.

proxy.caption: Proxy
proxy.description: If a proxy connection is present, the connection from the client to the proxy server.

public_ip.caption: Public IP
public_ip.description: The public IP address of an endpoint or a device.

query_string.caption: HTTP Query String
query_string.description: The query portion of the URL. For example: the query portion of the URL http://www.example.com/search?q=bad&sort=date is q=bad&sort=date.

query_time.caption: Query Time
query_time.description: The Domain Name System (DNS) query time.

query_time_dt.caption: Query Time
query_time_dt.description: The Domain Name System (DNS) query time.

ram_size.caption: RAM Size
ram_size.description: The ctotal amount of installed RAM, in Megabytes. For example: 2048.

raw_data.caption: Raw Data
raw_data.description: The raw event/finding data as received from the source.

rcode.caption: Response Code
rcode.description: The server response code, normalized to the caption of the rcode_id value. In the case of 'Other', it is defined by the event source.

rcode_id.caption: Response Code ID
rcode_id.description: The normalized identifier of the server response code. See specific usage.

99.caption: Other
99.description: The dns response code is not defined by the RFC.

rdata.caption: DNS RData
rdata.description: The data describing the DNS resource. The meaning of this data depends on the type and class of the resource record.

referrer.caption: HTTP Referrer
referrer.description: The request header that identifies the address of the previous web page, which is linked to the current web page or resource being requested.

region.caption: Region
region.description: The name or the code of a region. See specific usage.

related_analytics.caption: Related Analytics
related_analytics.description: Describes analytics related to the analytic of a finding or detection as identified by the security product.

related_events.caption: Related Events
related_events.description: Describes events related to a finding or detection as identified by the security product.

related_vulnerabilities.caption: Related Vulnerabilities
related_vulnerabilities.description: List of vulnerabilities that are related to this vulnerability.

relay.caption: Relay
relay.description: The network relay that is associated with the event.

release.caption: Software Release Details
release.description: Release is the number of times a version of the software has been packaged.

remediation.caption: Remediation
remediation.description: The remediation recommendations on how to fix the identified issue(s).

remote_display.caption: Remote Display
remote_display.description: The remote display affiliated with the event

reply_to.caption: Reply To
reply_to.description: The machine-readable email header Reply-To values, as defined by RFC 5322. For example example.user@usersdomain.com

reply_to_mailboxes.caption: Reply To Mailboxes
reply_to_mailboxes.description: The human-readable email header Reply To Mailbox values. For example 'Example User <example.user@usersdomain.com>'.

reputation.caption: Reputation Scores
reputation.description: Contains the original and normalized reputation scores.

request.caption: API Request Details
request.description: General Purpose API Request Object. See specific usage

requested_permissions.caption: Requested Permissions
requested_permissions.description: The permissions mask that were requested by the process.

requirements.caption: Requirements
requirements.description: A list of applicable compliance requirements for which this finding is related to.

resource_type.caption: Resource Type
resource_type.description: The context in which a resource was retrieved in a web request.

resource_uid.caption: Resource ID
resource_uid.description: The unique identifier of a cloud resource. For example, S3 Bucket name, EC2 Instance Id.

resources.caption: Resources Array
resources.description: Describes details about resources that were affected by the activity/event.

response.caption: API Response Details
response.description: General Purpose API Response Object. See specific usage.

response_time.caption: Response Time
response_time.description: The Domain Name System (DNS) response time.

response_time_dt.caption: Response Time
response_time_dt.description: The Domain Name System (DNS) response time.

risk_details.caption: Risk Details
risk_details.description: Describes the risk associated with the finding.

risk_level.caption: Risk Level
risk_level.description: The risk level, normalized to the caption of the risk_level_id value. In the case of 'Other', it is defined by the event source.

risk_score.caption: Risk Score
risk_score.description: The risk score as reported by the event source.

rule.caption: Rule
rule.description: The rules that reported the events.

run_state.caption: Run State
run_state.description: The state of the job or service, normalized to the caption of the run_state_id value. In the case of 'Other', it is defined by the event source. See specific usage.

run_state_id.caption: Run State ID
run_state_id.description: The normalized identifier of the state of the job or service. See specific usage.

samesite.caption: SameSite
samesite.description: The cookie attribute that lets servers specify whether/when cookies are sent with cross-site requests. Values are: Strict, Lax or None

sandbox.caption: Sandbox
sandbox.description: The name of the containment jail (i.e., sandbox). For example, hardened_ps, high_security_ps, oracle_ps, netsvcs_ps, or default_ps.

sans.caption: Subject Alternative Names
sans.description: The list of subject alternative names that are secured by a specific certificate.

scale_factor.caption: Scale Factor
scale_factor.description: The numeric scale factor of display.

scheme.caption: Scheme
scheme.description: The scheme portion of the URL. For example: http, https, ftp, or sftp.

score.caption: Reputation Score
score.description: The reputation score, normalized to the caption of the score_id value. In the case of 'Other', it is defined by the event source.

2.caption: Safe
2.description: Consistently good behavior.

3.caption: Probably Safe
3.description: Reasonable history of good behavior.

4.caption: Leans Safe
4.description: Starting to establish a history of normal behavior.

5.caption: May not be Safe
5.description: No established history of normal behavior.

6.caption: Exercise Caution
6.description: Starting to establish a history of suspicious or risky behavior.

7.caption: Suspicious/Risky
7.description: A site with a history of suspicious or risky behavior. (spam, scam, potentially unwanted software, potentially malicious).

99.caption: Other
99.description: The reputation score is not mapped. See the rep_score attribute, which contains a data source specific value.

secure.caption: Secure
secure.description: The cookie attribute to only send cookies to the server with an encrypted request over the HTTPS protocol.

security_questions.caption: Security Questions
security_questions.description: The question(s) provided to user for a question-based authentication factor.

sequence.caption: Sequence Number
sequence.description: Sequence number of the event. The sequence number is a value available in some events, to make the exact ordering of events unambiguous, regardless of the event time precision.

serial_number.caption: Serial Number
serial_number.description: The serial number that pertains to the object. See specific usage.

server_ciphers.caption: Server Cipher Suites
server_ciphers.description: The server cipher suites that were exchanged during the TLS handshake negotiation.

service.caption: Service
service.description: The service that pertains to the event.

severity.caption: Severity
severity.description: The event severity, normalized to the caption of the severity_id value. In the case of 'Other', it is defined by the event source.

severity_id.caption: Severity ID
severity_id.description:
The normalized identifier of the event severity.

The normalized severity is a measurement the effort and expense required to manage and resolve an event or incident. Smaller numerical values represent lower impact events, and larger numerical values represent higher impact events.

0.caption: Unknown
0.description: The event severity is not known.

2.caption: Low
2.description: The user decides if action is needed.

3.caption: Medium
3.description: Action is required but the situation is not serious at this time.

5.caption: Critical
5.description: Action is required immediately and the scope is broad.

6.caption: Fatal
6.description: An error occurred but it is too late to take remedial action.

99.caption: Other
99.description: The event severity is not mapped. See the severity attribute, which contains a data source specific value.

share.caption: Share
share.description: The share name. See specific usage.

share_type.caption: Share Type
share_type.description: The share type, normalized to the caption of the share_type_id value. In the case of 'Other', it is defined by the event source.

share_type_id.caption: Share Type Id
share_type_id.description: The normalized identifier of the share type.

99.caption: Other
99.description: The share type is not mapped. See the share_type attribute, which contains a data source specific value.

signature.caption: Digital Signature
signature.description: The digital signature of the file.

size.caption: Size
size.description: The size of data, in bytes.

smtp_from.caption: SMTP From
smtp_from.description: The value of the SMTP MAIL FROM command.

smtp_hello.caption: SMTP Hello
smtp_hello.description: The value of the SMTP HELO or EHLO command.

smtp_to.caption: SMTP To
smtp_to.description: The value of the SMTP envelope RCPT TO command.

sni.caption: Server Name Indication
sni.description: The Server Name Indication (SNI) extension sent by the client.

source.caption: Source
source.description: The source of an event is the data input from which it originates. In the case of data monitored from files and directories, the source consists of the full pathname of the file or directory. In the case of a network-based source, the source field consists of the protocol and port, such as UDP:514.

source_type.caption: Source Type
source_type.description: The source type of an event is the format of the data input from which it originates.

sp_name.caption: OS Service Pack
sp_name.description: The name of the latest Service Pack.

sp_ver.caption: OS Service Pack Version
sp_ver.description: The version number of the latest Service Pack.

spf.caption: SPF Status
spf.description: The Sender Policy Framework (SPF) status of the email.

src_endpoint.caption: Source Endpoint
src_endpoint.description: The network source endpoint.

src_url.caption: Source URL
src_url.description: The URL pointing towards the source of an entity. See specific usage.

start_address.caption: Start Address
start_address.description: The start address of the execution.

start_date.caption: Start Date
start_date.description: The start date of a user's employment.

start_date_dt.caption: Start Date
start_date_dt.description: The start date of a user's employment.

start_time.caption: Start Time
start_time.description: The start time of a time period. See specific usage.

start_time_dt.caption: Start Time
start_time_dt.description: The start time of a time period. See specific usage.

state.caption: State
state.description: The state of the event or object, normalized to the caption of the state_id value. In the case of 'Other', it is defined by the event source. See specific usage.

state_id.caption: State ID
state_id.description: The normalized state ID of the event or object. See specific usage.

99.caption: Other
99.description: The state is not mapped. See the state attribute, which contains a data source specific value.

status.caption: Status
status.description: The event status, normalized to the caption of the status_id value. In the case of 'Other', it is defined by the event source.

status_code.caption: Status Code
status_code.description:
The event status code, as reported by the event source.

For example, in a Windows Failed Authentication event, this would be the value of 'Failure Code', e.g. 0x18.

status_detail.caption: Status Detail
status_detail.description: The status detail contains additional information about the event/finding outcome.

status_details.caption: Status Details
status_details.description: A list of descriptions, containing additional information about the event/finding status.

status_id.caption: Status ID
status_id.description: The normalized identifier of the event status.

99.caption: Other
99.description: The event status is not mapped. See the status attribute, which contains a data source specific value.

subject.caption: Subject
subject.description: The email header Subject value, as defined by RFC 5322.

subnet_uid.caption: Subnet UID
subnet_uid.description: The unique identifier of a virtual subnet.

supporting_data.caption: Supporting Data
supporting_data.description: Additional data supporting a finding as provided by security tool

svc_name.caption: Service Name
svc_name.description: The service name in service-to-service connections. For example, AWS VPC logs the pkt-src-aws-service and pkt-dst-aws-service fields identify the connection is coming from or going to an AWS service.

system_call.caption: System Call
system_call.description: The system call that was invoked.

tactics.caption: Tactics
tactics.description: The a list of tactic ID's/names that are associated with the attack technique, as defined by ATT&CK MatrixTM.

tags.caption: Tags
tags.description: The list of tags; {key:value} pairs attached to an entity. A Tag may be used to categorize, filter, and search for entities. For e.g. "Environment": "Production", "Owner": "007". See specific usage.

target.caption: Target
target.description: The desired entity towards which the action is directed. Its values are derived via business logic. This usually represents the inferred destination entity for a logon.

tcp_flags.caption: TCP Flags
tcp_flags.description: The network connection TCP header flags (i.e., control bits).

terminal.caption: Terminal
terminal.description: The Pseudo Terminal. Ex: the tty or pts value.

terminated_time.caption: Terminated Time
terminated_time.description: The time when the entity was terminated. See specific usage.

terminated_time_dt.caption: Terminated Time
terminated_time_dt.description: The time when the entity was terminated. See specific usage.

tid.caption: Thread ID
tid.description: The Identifier of the thread associated with the event, as returned by the operating system.

time.caption: Event Time
time.description: The normalized event occurrence time or the finding creation time.

time_dt.caption: Event Time
time_dt.description: The normalized event occurrence time or the finding creation time.

timezone_offset.caption: Timezone Offset
timezone_offset.description: The number of minutes that the reported event time is ahead or behind UTC, in the range -1,080 to +1,080.

title.caption: Title
title.description: The title of an entity. See specific usage.

to.caption: To
to.description: The email header To values, as defined by RFC 5322.

to_mailboxes.caption: To Mailboxes
to_mailboxes.description: The human-readable email header To Mailbox values. For example 'Example User <example.user@usersdomain.com>'.

traffic.caption: Traffic
traffic.description: The network traffic refers to the amount of data moving across a network at a given point of time. Intended to be used alongside Network Connection.

transaction_uid.caption: Transaction UID
transaction_uid.description: The unique identifier of the transaction.

transmit_time.caption: Transmission Time
transmit_time.description: The event transmission time from one device to another.  See specific usage

transmit_time_dt.caption: Transmission Time
transmit_time_dt.description: The event transmission time from one device to another.  See specific usage

tree_uid.caption: Tree UID
tree_uid.description: The tree id is a unique SMB identifier which represents an open connection to a share.

true_color.caption: True Color
true_color.description: A boolean indicating whether to extract pixel values through red/green/blue intensities.

ttl.caption: TTL
ttl.description: The time interval that the resource record may be cached. Zero value means that the resource record can only be used for the transaction in progress, and should not be cached.

tunnel_interface.caption: Tunnel Interface
tunnel_interface.description: The interface of a tunnel. In a tunnelled session, this is the virtual interface. Ex: utun1. The IP is usually a private (local rfc-1918) IP.

tunnel_type.caption: Type
tunnel_type.description: The tunnel type. See specific usage.

type.caption: Type
type.description: The type of an object or value, normalized to the caption of the type_id value. In the case of 'Other', it is defined by the event source. See specific usage.

type_id.caption: Type ID
type_id.description: The normalized type identifier of an object. See specific usage.

99.caption: Other
99.description: The type is not mapped. See the type attribute, which may contain a data source specific value.

type_name.caption: Type Name
type_name.description: The event/finding type name, as defined by the type_uid.

type_uid.caption: Type ID
type_uid.description: The event type ID. It identifies the event's semantics and structure. The value is calculated by the logging system as: class_uid * 100 + activity_id.

types.caption: Types
types.description: The type/s of an entity. See specific usage.

uid.caption: Unique ID
uid.description: The unique identifier. See specific usage.

uid_alt.caption: Alternate ID
uid_alt.description: The alternate unique identifier. See specific usage.

unmapped.caption: Unmapped Data
unmapped.description: The attributes that are not mapped to the event schema. The names and values of those attributes are specific to the event source.

url.caption: URL
url.description: The URL object that pertains to the event or object. See specific usage.

urls.caption: URLs
urls.description: The URLs that pertain to the event or object.

user.caption: User
user.description: The user that pertains to the event or object.

user_agent.caption: HTTP User-Agent
user_agent.description: The request header that identifies the operating system and web browser.

user_result.caption: User Result
user_result.description: The result of the user account change. It should contain the new values of the changed attributes.

users.caption: Users
users.description: The users that are identified in reported the events.

uuid.caption: UUID
uuid.description: The universally unique identifier. See specific usage.

value.caption: Value
value.description: The value that pertains to the object. See specific usage.

vector_string.caption: Vector String
vector_string.description: The CVSS vector string is a text representation of a set of CVSS metrics. It is commonly used to record or transfer CVSS metric information in a concise form. For example: 3.1/AV:L/AC:L/PR:L/UI:N/S:U/C:H/I:N/A:H.

vendor_id_list.caption: Vendor ID List
vendor_id_list.description: The list of vendor IDs. See specific usage.

vendor_name.caption: Vendor Name
vendor_name.description: The name of the vendor. See specific usage.

version.caption: Version
version.description: The version that pertains to the event or object. See specific usage.

vnc_auth.caption: VNC Authentication
vnc_auth.description: The Virtual Network Computing (VNC) authentication object describes the VNC authentication values.

vpc_uid.caption: VPC UID
vpc_uid.description: The unique identifier of the Virtual Private Cloud (VPC).

vulnerabilities.caption: Vulnerabilities
vulnerabilities.description: This object describes vulnerabilities reported in a security finding.

vulnerability.caption: Vulnerability
vulnerability.description: The vulnerability object describes details related to the observed vulnerability

win_resource.caption: Windows Resource
win_resource.description: The Windows resource object that was accessed, such as a mutant or timer.

x_forwarded_for.caption: X-Forwarded-For
x_forwarded_for.description: The X-Forwarded-For header identifying the originating IP address(es) of a client connecting to a web server through an HTTP proxy or a load balancer.

x_originating_ip.caption: X-Originating-IP
x_originating_ip.description: The X-Originating-IP header identifying the emails originating IP address(es).

xattributes.caption: Extended Attributes
xattributes.description:
An unordered collection of zero or more name/value pairs where each pair represents a file or folder extended attribute.

For example: Windows alternate data stream attributes (ADS stream name, ADS size, etc.), user-defined or application-defined attributes, ACL, owner, primary group, etc. Examples from DCS:

  • ads_name
  • ads_size
  • dacl
  • owner
  • primary_group
  • link_name - name of the link associated to the file.
  • hard_link_count - the number of links that are associated to the file.

zone.caption: Network Zone
zone.description: The network zone or LAN segment.

dictionary.caption: Attribute Dictionary
dictionary.description: The Attribute Dictionary defines attributes and includes references to the events and objects in which they are used.
dictionary.name: dictionary

datetime_t.caption: Datetime
datetime_t.description: The Internet Date/Time format as defined in RFC-3339. For example 1985-04-12T23:20:50.52Z.

file_hash_t.caption: File Hash
file_hash_t.description: File hash. A unique value that corresponds to the content of the file.

hostname_t.caption: Hostname
hostname_t.description: Unique name assigned to a device connected to a computer network. A domain name in general is an Internet address that can be resolved through the Domain Name System (DNS). For example: r2-d2.example.com.

ip_t.caption: IP Address
ip_t.description: Internet Protocol address (IP address), in either IPv4 or IPv6 format.

json_t.caption: JSON
json_t.description: Embedded JSON value. A value can be a string, or a number, or true or false or null, or an object or an array. These structures can be nested. See www.json.org.

mac_t.caption: MAC Address
mac_t.description: Media Access Control (MAC) address. For example: 18:36:F3:98:4F:9A.

object_t.caption: Object
object_t.description: Object is an unordered set of name/value pairs. For example: {ip: 92.24.47.250, type: IP Address}

path_t.caption: Path Name
path_t.description: File or folder full path name. For example: /home/user/tmp/text-file.txt.

port_t.caption: Port
port_t.description: The TCP/UDP port number. For example: 80 or 22.

resource_uid_t.caption: Resource UID
resource_uid_t.description: Resource unique identifier. For example, S3 Bucket name or EC2 Instance ID.

subnet_t.caption: Subnet
subnet_t.description: Subnet mask in Classless Inter-Domain Routing (CIDR) notation. For example 192.168.200.0/24.

timestamp_t.caption: Timestamp
timestamp_t.description: The timestamp format is the number of milliseconds since the Epoch 01/01/1970 00:00:00 UTC. For example 1618524549901.

url_t.caption: URL String
url_t.description: Uniform Resource Locator (URL) string. For example: http://www.example.com/download/trouble.exe.

types.caption: Data Types
types.description: The predefined data types. The data type specifies what kind of data a value can have.

labels.caption: Labels
labels.description: The list of labels/tags associated to the account.

name.caption: Name
name.description: The name of the account (e.g. GCP Project name , Linux Account name or AWS Account name ).

type.caption: Type
type.description: The account type, normalized to the caption of 'account_type_id'. In the case of 'Other', it is defined by the event source.

99.caption: Other
99.description: The account type is not mapped.

uid.caption: Unique ID
uid.description: The unique identifier of the account (e.g. AWS Account ID , OCID , GCP Project ID , Azure Subscription ID , Google Workspace Customer ID , or M365 Tenant UID ).

account.caption: Account
account.description: The Account object contains details about the account that initiated or performed a specific activity within a system or application. Additionally, the Account object refers to logical Cloud and Software-as-a-Service (SaaS) based containers such as AWS Accounts, Azure Subscriptions, Oracle Cloud Compartments, Google Cloud Projects, and otherwise.
account.name: account

authorizations.caption: Authorization Information
authorizations.description: This object provides details such as authorization outcome, associated policies related to activity/event.

idp.caption: Identity Provider
idp.description: This object describes details about the Identity Provider used.

invoked_by.caption: Invoked by
invoked_by.description: The name of the service that invoked the activity as described in the event.

process.caption: Process
process.description: The process that initiated the activity.

session.caption: User Session
session.description: The user session from which the activity was initiated.

user.caption: User
user.description: The user that initiated the activity or the user context from which the activity was initiated.

actor.caption: Actor
actor.description: The actor object describes details about the user/role/process that was the source of the activity.
actor.name: actor

desc.caption: Description
desc.description: The description of the analytic that generated the finding.

name.caption: Name
name.description: The name of the analytic that generated the finding.

@deprecated.message: Related Analytics has been decoupled from this object, instead use finding_info.related_analytics.

related_analytics.caption: Related Analytics
related_analytics.description: Other analytics related to this analytic.

type.caption: Type
type.description: The analytic type.

1.caption: Rule
1.description: A Rule in security analytics refers to predefined criteria or conditions set to monitor, alert, or enforce policies, playing a crucial role in access control, threat detection, and regulatory compliance across security systems.

10.caption: Partial Data Match
10.description: Partial Data Match involves identifying instances where segments of sensitive information or patterns match, facilitating nuanced DLP and threat detection without requiring complete data conformity.

11.caption: Indexed Data Match
11.description: Indexed Data Match refers to comparing content against a pre-compiled index of sensitive information to efficiently detect and prevent unauthorized access or breaches, streamlining DLP and compliance efforts.

2.caption: Behavioral
2.description: Behavioral analytics focus on monitoring and analyzing user or system actions to identify deviations from established patterns, aiding in the detection of insider threats, fraud, and advanced persistent threats (APTs).

3.caption: Statistical
3.description: Statistical analytics pertains to analyzing data patterns and anomalies using statistical models to predict, detect, and respond to potential threats, enhancing overall security posture through informed decision-making.

4.caption: Learning (ML/DL)
4.description: Learning (ML/DL) encompasses techniques that can "learn" from known data to create analytics that generalize to new data. There may be a statistical component to these techniques, but it is not a requirement.

5.caption: Fingerprinting
5.description: Fingerprinting is the technique of collecting detailed system data, including software versions and configurations, to enhance threat detection, data loss prevention (DLP), and endpoint detection and response (EDR) capabilities.

6.caption: Tagging
6.description: Tagging refers to the practice of assigning labels or identifiers to data, users, assets, or activities to monitor, control access, and facilitate incident response across various security domains such as DLP and EDR.

7.caption: Keyword Match
7.description: Keyword Match involves scanning content for specific terms to identify sensitive information, potential threats, or policy violations, aiding in DLP and compliance monitoring.

8.caption: Regular Expressions
8.description: Regular Expressions are used to define complex search patterns for identifying, validating, and extracting specific data sets or threats within digital content, enhancing DLP, EDR, and threat detection mechanisms.

9.caption: Exact Data Match
9.description: Exact Data Match is a precise comparison technique used to detect the unauthorized use or exposure of specific, sensitive information, crucial for enforcing DLP policies and protecting against data breaches.

99.caption: Other
99.description: The type is not mapped. See the type attribute, which may contain a data source specific value.

uid.caption: Unique ID
uid.description: The unique identifier of the analytic that generated the finding.

analytic.caption: Analytic
analytic.description: The Analytic object contains details about the analytic technique used to analyze and derive insights from the data or information that led to the creation of a finding or conclusion.
analytic.name: analytic

request.caption: API Request Details
request.description: Details pertaining to the API request.

response.caption: API Response Details
response.description: Details pertaining to the API response.

service.caption: Service
service.description: The information pertaining to the API service.

version.caption: Version
version.description: The version of the API service.

api.caption: API Details
api.description: API object details information pertaining to the API calls
api.name: api

tactics.caption: Tactics
tactics.description: The a list of tactic ID's/names that are associated with the attack technique, as defined by ATT&CK MatrixTM.

attack.caption: Attack
attack.description: The attack object describes the technique and associated tactics related to an attack.
attack.name: attack

device.caption: Device
device.description: Device used to complete an authentication request.

email_addr.caption: Email Address
email_addr.description: The email address used in an email-based authentication factor.

factor_type.caption: Factor Type
factor_type.description: The type of authentication factor used in an authentication attempt.

factor_type_id.caption: Factor Type ID
factor_type_id.description: The normalized identifier for the authentication factor.

1.caption: SMS
1.description: User receives and inputs a code sent to their mobile device via SMS text message.

10.caption: WebAuthn
10.description: Web-based API that enables users to register devices as authentication factors.

11.caption: Password
11.description: The user enters a password that they have previously established.

2.caption: Security Question
2.description: The user responds to a security question as part of a question-based authentication factor

3.caption: Phone Call
3.description: System calls the user's registered phone number and requires the user to answer and provide a response.

4.caption: Biometric
4.description: Devices that verify identity-based on user's physical identifiers, such as fingerprint scanners or retina scanners.

5.caption: Push Notification
5.description: Push notification is sent to user's registered device and requires the user to acknowledge.

6.caption: Hardware Token
6.description: Physical device that generates a code to be used for authentication.

7.caption: OTP
7.description: Application generates a one-time password (OTP) for use in authentication.

8.caption: Email
8.description: A code or link is sent to a user's registered email address.

9.caption: U2F
9.description: Typically involves a hardware token, which the user physically interacts with to authenticate.

is_hotp.caption: HMAC-based One-time Password (HOTP)
is_hotp.description: Whether the authentication factor is an HMAC-based One-time Password (HOTP).

is_totp.caption: Time-based One-time Password (TOTP)
is_totp.description: Whether the authentication factor is a Time-based One-time Password (TOTP).

phone_number.caption: Phone Number
phone_number.description: The phone number used for a telephony-based authentication request.

provider.caption: Provider
provider.description: The name of provider for an authentication factor.

security_questions.caption: Security Questions
security_questions.description: The question(s) provided to user for a question-based authentication factor.

auth_factor.caption: Authentication Factor
auth_factor.description: An Authentication Factor object describes a category of methods used for identity verification in an authentication attempt.
auth_factor.name: auth_factor

created_time.caption: Created Time
created_time.description: The time that the authentication token was created.

created_time_dt.caption: Created Time
created_time_dt.description: The time that the authentication token was created.

encryption_details.caption: Encryption Details
encryption_details.description: The encryption details of the authentication token.

expiration_time.caption: Expiration Time
expiration_time.description: The expiration time of the authentication token.

expiration_time_dt.caption: Expiration Time
expiration_time_dt.description: The expiration time of the authentication token.

is_renewable.caption: Renewable
is_renewable.description: Indicates whether the authentication token is renewable.

kerberos_flags.caption: Kerberos Flags
kerberos_flags.description: A bitmask, either in hexadecimal or decimal form, which encodes various attributes or permissions associated with a Kerberos ticket. These flags delineate specific characteristics of the ticket, such as its renewability or forwardability.

type.caption: Type
type.description: The type of the authentication token.

type_id.caption: Type ID
type_id.description: The normalized authentication token type identifier.

0.caption: Unknown
0.description: The Authentication token type is unknown.

2.caption: Service Ticket
2.description: Service Ticket (ST) for Kerberos.

3.caption: Identity Token
3.description: Identity (ID) Token for OIDC.

5.caption: SAML Assertion
5.description: Authentication Assertion for SAML.

99.caption: Other
99.description: The type is not mapped. See the type attribute, which may contain a data source specific value.

authentication_token.caption: Authentication Token
authentication_token.description: The Authentication Token object contains the attributes pertaining to an authentication token, ticket, or assertion e.g. Kerberos, OIDC, SAML.
authentication_token.name: authentication_token

policy.caption: Policy
policy.description: Details about the Identity/Access management policies that are applicable.

authorization.caption: Authorization Information
authorization.description: This object provides details such as authorization outcome, associated policies related to activity/event.
authorization.name: authorization

name.caption: Name
name.description: Organization name for the Autonomous System.

number.caption: Number
number.description: Unique number that the AS is identified by.

autonomous_system.caption: Autonomous System
autonomous_system.description: An autonomous system (AS) is a collection of connected Internet Protocol (IP) routing prefixes under the control of one or more network operators on behalf of a single administrative entity or domain that presents a common, clearly defined routing policy to the internet.
autonomous_system.name: autonomous_system

created_time.caption: Created Time
created_time.description: The time when the certificate was created.

created_time_dt.caption: Created Time
created_time_dt.description: The time when the certificate was created.

expiration_time.caption: Expiration Time
expiration_time.description: The expiration time of the certificate.

expiration_time_dt.caption: Expiration Time
expiration_time_dt.description: The expiration time of the certificate.

serial_number.caption: Certificate Serial Number
serial_number.description: The serial number of the certificate.

certificate.caption: Digital Certificate
certificate.description: The Public Key Certificate, or a digital certificate, is used to prove the ownership of a public key. The certificate includes information about its lifetime, about the identity of its owner (called the subject) and the digital signature of an entity that has verified the certificate's contents (called the issuer).
certificate.name: certificate

name.caption: Name
name.description: The CIS benchmark name.

remediation.caption: Remediation
remediation.description: The remediation recommendations on how to fix the identified issue(s).

cis_benchmark_result.caption: CIS Benchmark Result
cis_benchmark_result.description: The Center for Internet Security (CIS) benchmark result. CIS Benchmarks are a collection of best practices for securely configuring IT systems, software, networks, and cloud infrastructure.
cis_benchmark_result.name: cis_benchmark_result

version.caption: Version
version.description: The CIS critical security control version.

cis_control.caption: CIS Control
cis_control.description: The Center for Internet Security Critical Security Control (CIS CSC). Prioritized set of actions to protect your organization and data from cyber-attack vectors.
cis_control.name: cis_control

account_name.caption: Account Name
account_name.description: The name of the account (e.g. AWS Account Name).

account_uid.caption: Account UID
account_uid.description: The unique identifier of the account (e.g. AWS Account ID).

org_uid.caption: Org ID
org_uid.description: The unique identifier of the organization to which the user belongs. For example, Active Directory or AWS Org ID.

project_uid.caption: Project ID
project_uid.description: The unique identifier of a Cloud project.

provider.caption: Provider
provider.description: The unique name of the Cloud services provider, such as AWS, MS Azure, GCP, etc.

region.caption: Region
region.description: The name of the cloud region, as defined by the cloud provider.

zone.caption: Network Zone
zone.description: The availability zone in the cloud region, as defined by the cloud provider.

cloud.caption: Cloud
cloud.description: The Cloud object provides details about a cloud account pertaining to the event, like AWS Account ID, regions, et al.
cloud.name: cloud

requirements.caption: Requirements
requirements.description: A list of applicable compliance requirements for which this finding is related to.

status.caption: Status
status.description: The event status, normalized to the caption of the status_id value. In the case of 'Other', it is defined by the event source.

status_detail.caption: Status Detail
status_detail.description: The status detail contains additional information about the event/finding outcome.

compliance.caption: Compliance Details
compliance.description: Compliance object provides compliance details related of a finding generated by security tool.
compliance.name: compliance

exposed_port.caption: Port
exposed_port.description: The port exposed by container to allow access of run application remotely.

fingerprint.caption: Fingerprint
fingerprint.description: Commit hash of image created for docker or the SHA256 hash of the container. For example: a3bf90e006b2.

image.caption: Image
image.description: The container image used as a template to run the container.

name.caption: Name
name.description: The container name.

network_driver.caption: Network Driver
network_driver.description: The network driver used by the container.

orchestrator.caption: Orchestrator
orchestrator.description: The orchestrator managing the container, such as ECS, EKS, K8s, OpenShift, None.

size.caption: Size
size.description: The size of the container image.

tag.caption: Image Tag
tag.description: The tag used by the container. It can indicate version, format, OS.

uid.caption: Unique ID
uid.description: The container unique identifier. For example: a3bf90e006b2.

container.caption: Container
container.description: The Container object describes a specific container, which is a source of events. A Docker container is a lightweight, standalone, executable package of software that includes everything needed to run an application: code, runtime, system tools, system libraries and settings.
container.name: container

created_time.caption: Record Creation Date
created_time.description: The Record Creation Date identifies when the CVE ID was issued to a CVE Numbering Authority (CNA) or the CVE Record was published on the CVE List. Note that the Record Creation Date does not necessarily indicate when this vulnerability was discovered, shared with the affected vendor, publicly disclosed, or updated in CVE.

created_time_dt.caption: Record Creation Date
created_time_dt.description: The Record Creation Date identifies when the CVE ID was issued to a CVE Numbering Authority (CNA) or the CVE Record was published on the CVE List. Note that the Record Creation Date does not necessarily indicate when this vulnerability was discovered, shared with the affected vendor, publicly disclosed, or updated in CVE.

cvss.caption: CVSS Score
cvss.description: The CVSS object details Common Vulnerability Scoring System (CVSS) scores from the advisory that are related to the vulnerability.

cwe_uid.caption: CWE UID
cwe_uid.description: The Common Weakness Enumeration (CWE) unique identifier. For example: CWE-787.

cwe_url.caption: CWE URL
cwe_url.description: Common Weakness Enumiration (CWE) definition URL. For example: https://cwe.mitre.org/data/definitions/787.html.

modified_time.caption: Record Modified Date
modified_time.description: The Record Modified Date identifies when the CVE record was last updated.

modified_time_dt.caption: Record Modified Date
modified_time_dt.description: The Record Modified Date identifies when the CVE record was last updated.

product.caption: Product
product.description: The product where the vulnerability was discovered.

type.caption: Vulnerability Type
type.description:
The vulnerability type as selected from a large dropdown menu during CVE refinement.

Most frequently used vulnerability types are: DoS, Code Execution, Overflow, Memory Corruption, Sql Injection, XSS, Directory Traversal, Http Response Splitting, Bypass something, Gain Information, Gain Privileges, CSRF, File Inclusion. For more information see Vulnerabilities By Type distributions.

uid.caption: CVE ID
uid.description: The Common Vulnerabilities and Exposures unique number assigned to a specific computer vulnerability. A CVE Identifier begins with 4 digits representing the year followed by a sequence of digits that acts as a unique identifier. For example: CVE-2021-12345.

cve.caption: CVE
cve.description: The Common Vulnerabilities and Exposures (CVE) object represents publicly disclosed cybersecurity vulnerabilities defined in CVE Program catalog (CVE). There is one CVE Record for each vulnerability in the catalog.
cve.name: cve

base_score.caption: Base Score
base_score.description: The CVSS base score. For example: 9.1.

depth.caption: CVSS Depth
depth.description: The CVSS depth represents a depth of the equation used to calculate CVSS score.

metrics.caption: Metrics
metrics.description: The Common Vulnerability Scoring System metrics.This attribute contains information on the CVE's impact. If the CVE has been analyzed, this attribute will contain any CVSSv2 or CVSSv3 information associated with the vulnerability. For example: {{"Access Vector", "Network"}, {"Access Complexity", "Low"}, ...}.

overall_score.caption: Overall Score
overall_score.description: The CVSS overall score, impacted by base, temporal, and environmental metrics. For example: 9.1.

severity.caption: Severity
severity.description:
The Common Vulnerability Scoring System (CVSS) Qualitative Severity Rating. A textual representation of the numeric score.

CVSS v2.0
  • Low (0.0 3.9)
  • Medium (4.0 6.9)
  • High (7.0 10.0)

CVSS v3.0
  • None (0.0)
  • Low (0.1 - 3.9)
  • Medium (4.0 - 6.9)
  • High (7.0 - 8.9)
  • Critical (9.0 - 10.0)

vector_string.caption: Vector String
vector_string.description: The CVSS vector string is a text representation of a set of CVSS metrics. It is commonly used to record or transfer CVSS metric information in a concise form. For example: 3.1/AV:L/AC:L/PR:L/UI:N/S:U/C:H/I:N/A:H.

cvss.caption: CVSS Score
cvss.description: The Common Vulnerability Scoring System (CVSS) object provides a way to capture the principal characteristics of a vulnerability and produce a numerical score reflecting its severity.
cvss.name: cvss

category.caption: Category
category.description: The name of the data classification category that data matched into, e.g. Financial, Personal, Governmental, etc.

category_id.caption: Category ID
category_id.description: The normalized identifier of the data classification category.

0.caption: Unknown
0.description: The type is not mapped. See the data_type attribute, which contains a data source specific value.

1.caption: Personal
1.description: Any Personally Identifiable Information (PII), Electronic Personal Health Information (ePHI), or similarly personal information. E.g., full name, home address, date of birth, etc.

2.caption: Governmental
2.description: Any sensitive government identification number related to a person or other classified material. E.g., Passport numbers, driver license numbers, business identification, taxation identifiers, etc.

3.caption: Financial
3.description: Any financially-related sensitive information or Cardholder Data (CHD). E.g., banking account numbers, credit card numbers, International Banking Account Numbers (IBAN), SWIFT codes, etc.

4.caption: Business
4.description: Any business-specific sensitive data such as intellectual property, trademarks, copyrights, human resource data, Board of Directors meeting minutes, and similar.

5.caption: Military and Law Enforcement
5.description: Any mission-specific sensitive data for military, law enforcement, or other government agencies such as specifically classified data, weapon systems information, or other planning data.

6.caption: Security
6.description: Any sensitive security-related data such as passwords, passkeys, IP addresses, API keys, credentials and similar secrets. E.g., AWS Access Secret Key, SaaS API Keys, user passwords, database credentials, etc.

99.caption: Other
99.description: Any other type of data classification or a multi-variate classification made up of several other classification categories.

confidentiality.caption: Confidentiality
confidentiality.description: The file content confidentiality, normalized to the confidentiality_id value. In the case of 'Other', it is defined by the event source.

confidentiality_id.caption: Confidentiality ID
confidentiality_id.description: The normalized identifier of the file content confidentiality indicator.

policy.caption: Policy
policy.description: Details about the data policy that governs data handling and security measures related to classification.

data_classification.caption: Data Classification
data_classification.description: The Data Classification object includes information about data classification levels and data category types.
data_classification.name: data_classification

created_time.caption: Created Time
created_time.description: The time when the database was known to have been created.

created_time_dt.caption: Created Time
created_time_dt.description: The time when the database was known to have been created.

data_classification.caption: Data Classification
data_classification.description: The Data Classification object includes information about data classification levels and data category types.

groups.caption: Groups
groups.description: The group names to which the database belongs.

modified_time.caption: Modified Time
modified_time.description: The most recent time when any changes, updates, or modifications were made within the database.

modified_time_dt.caption: Modified Time
modified_time_dt.description: The most recent time when any changes, updates, or modifications were made within the database.

name.caption: Name
name.description: The database name, ordinarily as assigned by a database administrator.

size.caption: Size
size.description: The size of the database in bytes.

type.caption: Type
type.description: The database type.

type_id.caption: Type ID
type_id.description: The normalized identifier of the database type.

99.caption: Other
99.description: The type is not mapped. See the type attribute, which may contain a data source specific value.

uid.caption: Unique ID
uid.description: The unique identifier of the database.

database.caption: Database
database.description: The database object is used for databases which are typically datastore services that contain an organized collection of structured and unstructured data or a types of data.
database.name: database

created_time.description: The time when the databucket was known to have been created.

created_time_dt.caption: Created Time
created_time_dt.description: The time when the databucket was known to have been created.

data_classification.caption: Data Classification
data_classification.description: The Data Classification object includes information about data classification levels and data category types.

groups.caption: Groups
groups.description: The group names to which the databucket belongs.

modified_time.description: The most recent time when any changes, updates, or modifications were made within the databucket.

modified_time_dt.caption: Modified Time
modified_time_dt.description: The most recent time when any changes, updates, or modifications were made within the databucket.

name.caption: Name
name.description: The databucket name.

size.caption: Size
size.description: The size of the databucket in bytes.

type.caption: Type
type.description: The databucket type.

type_id.caption: Type ID
type_id.description: The normalized identifier of the databucket type.

99.caption: Other
99.description: The type is not mapped. See the type attribute, which may contain a data source specific value.

uid.caption: Unique ID
uid.description: The unique identifier of the databucket.

databucket.caption: Databucket
databucket.description: The databucket object is a basic container that holds data, typically organized through the use of data partitions.
databucket.name: databucket

command_response.caption: Command Response
command_response.description: The reply to the request command (e.g. RESPONSE, BINDACK or FAULT).

opnum.caption: Opnum
opnum.description: An operation number used to identify a specific remote procedure call (RPC) method or a method in an interface.

dce_rpc.caption: Distributed Computing Environment/Remote Procedure Call (DCE/RPC)
dce_rpc.description: The DCE/RPC object describes the remote procedure call system for distributed computing environments.
dce_rpc.name: dce_rpc

autoscale_uid.caption: Autoscale UID
autoscale_uid.description: The unique identifier of the cloud autoscale configuration.

domain.description: The network domain where the device resides. For example: work.example.com.

groups.description: The group names to which the device belongs. For example: <code>["Windows Laptops", "Engineering"]<code/>.

image.caption: Image
image.description: The image used as a template to run the virtual machine.

imei.description: The International Mobile Station Equipment Identifier that is associated with the device.

instance_uid.caption: Instance ID
instance_uid.description: The unique identifier of a VM instance.

interface_name.caption: Network Interface Name
interface_name.description: The name of the network interface (e.g. eth2).

interface_uid.caption: Network Interface ID
interface_uid.description: The unique identifier of the network interface.

ip.caption: IP Address
ip.description: The device IP address, in either IPv4 or IPv6 format.

ips.caption: IP List
ips.description: The IP addresses of an endpoint or a device.

is_compliant.description: The event occurred on a compliant device.

is_managed.caption: Managed Device
is_managed.description: The event occurred on a managed device.

is_personal.caption: Personal Device
is_personal.description: The event occurred on a personal device.

is_trusted.caption: Trusted Device
is_trusted.description: The event occurred on a trusted device.

labels.caption: Labels
labels.description: The list of labels attached to the device.

location.caption: Detailed Geo Location
location.description: The geographical location of the endpoint.

mac.caption: MAC Address
mac.description: The device Media Access Control (MAC) address.

macs.caption: MAC List
macs.description: The Media Access Control (MAC) addresses of an endpoint or a device.

name.caption: Name
name.description:
The alternate device name, ordinarily as assigned by an administrator.

Note: The Name could be any other string that helps to identify the device, such as a phone number; for example 310-555-1234.

network_interfaces.caption: Network Interfaces
network_interfaces.description:
The network interfaces that are associated with the device, one for each MAC address/IP address combination.

Note: The first element of the array is the network information that pertains to the event.

nt_hosts.caption: Network Host List
nt_hosts.description: The network hosts of an endpoint or a device.

org_unit.caption: Org Unit
org_unit.description: The name of the organization to which the user belongs.

owners.caption: Owners
owners.description: List of names of the services or user accounts that own the resource.

pci_domains.caption: PCI Domains
pci_domains.description: List of the PCI domains of an endpoint or device.

public_ip.caption: Public IP
public_ip.description: The public IP address of an endpoint or a device.

region.caption: Region
region.description: The region where the virtual machine is located. For example, an AWS Region.

risk_level.caption: Risk Level
risk_level.description: The risk level, normalized to the caption of the risk_level_id value. In the case of 'Other', it is defined by the event source.

risk_score.caption: Risk Score
risk_score.description: The risk score as reported by the event source.

subnet_uid.caption: Subnet UID
subnet_uid.description: The unique identifier of a virtual subnet.

type.caption: Type
type.description: The device type. For example: unknown, server, desktop, laptop, tablet, mobile, virtual, browser, or other.

2.caption: Desktop
2.description: A desktop computer.

3.caption: Laptop
3.description: A laptop computer.

5.caption: Mobile
5.description: A mobile phone.

6.caption: Virtual
6.description: A virtual machine.

7.caption: IOT
7.description: A IOT (Internet of Things) device.

99.caption: Other
99.description: The type is not mapped. See the type attribute, which may contain a data source specific value.

uid.caption: Unique ID
uid.description: The unique identifier of the device.

uid_alt.caption: Alternate ID
uid_alt.description: An alternate unique identifier of the device if any. For example the ActiveDirectory DN.

uuid.caption: UUID
uuid.description: The universally unique identifier of the device. For example, AWS EC2 instance UUID.

vpc_uid.caption: VPC UID
vpc_uid.description: The unique identifier of the Virtual Private Cloud (VPC).

device.caption: Device
device.description: Addressable device where events occurred.
device.name: device

bios_ver.caption: BIOS Version
bios_ver.description: The BIOS version. For example: LENOVO G5ETA2WW (2.62).

chassis.caption: Chassis
chassis.description: The chassis type describes the system enclosure or physical form factor. Such as the following examples for Windows Windows Chassis Types

cpu_bits.caption: CPU Bits
cpu_bits.description: The cpu architecture, the number of bits used for addressing in memory. For example: 32 or 64.

cpu_cores.caption: CPU Cores
cpu_cores.description: The number of processor cores in all installed processors. For Example: 42.

cpu_count.caption: CPU Count
cpu_count.description: The number of physical processors on a system. For example: 1.

cpu_speed.caption: Processor Type
cpu_speed.description: The speed of the processor in Mhz. For Example: 4200.

cpu_type.caption: Processor Type
cpu_type.description: The processor type. For example: x86 Family 6 Model 37 Stepping 5.

desktop_display.caption: Desktop Display
desktop_display.description: The desktop display affiliated with the event

ram_size.caption: RAM Size
ram_size.description: The ctotal amount of installed RAM, in Megabytes. For example: 2048.

company_name.caption: Company Name
company_name.description: The name of the company that published the file. For example: Microsoft Corporation.

created_time.caption: Created Time
created_time.description: The time when the digital signature was created.

created_time_dt.caption: Created Time
created_time_dt.description: The time when the digital signature was created.

developer_uid.caption: Developer UID
developer_uid.description: The developer ID on the certificate that signed the file.

fingerprints.caption: Fingerprints
fingerprints.description: An array of digital fingerprint objects.

serial_number.caption: Serial Number
serial_number.description: The serial number of the digital signature.

digital_signature.caption: Digital Signature
digital_signature.description: The digital signature of a file or application.

physical_height.caption: Physical Height
physical_height.description: The numeric physical height of display.

physical_orientation.caption: Physical Orientation
physical_orientation.description: The numeric physical orientation of display.

physical_width.caption: Physical Width
physical_width.description: The numeric physical width of display.

scale_factor.caption: Scale Factor
scale_factor.description: The numeric scale factor of display.

class.description: The class of DNS data contained in this resource record. See RFC1035. For example: IN.

flag_ids.caption: DNS Header Flags
flag_ids.description: The list of DNS answer header flag IDs.

99.description: The event DNS header flag is not mapped.

flags.caption: DNS Header Flags
flags.description: The list of DNS answer header flags.

packet_uid.description: The DNS packet identifier assigned by the program that generated the query. The identifier is copied to the response.

rdata.caption: DNS RData
rdata.description: The data describing the DNS resource. The meaning of this data depends on the type and class of the resource record.

ttl.caption: TTL
ttl.description: The time interval that the resource record may be cached. Zero value means that the resource record can only be used for the transaction in progress, and should not be cached.

type.caption: Resource Record Type
type.description: The type of data contained in this resource record. See RFC1035. For example: CNAME.

dns_answer.description: The Domain Name System (DNS) answer object.

class.description: The class of resource records being queried. See RFC1035. For example: IN.

opcode.description: The DNS opcode specifies the type of the query message.

opcode_id.description: The DNS opcode ID specifies the normalized query message type.

actor.caption: Actor

connection_info.caption: Connection Info
connection_info.description: Describes details about the network connection associated to the activity that triggered the detection.

container.caption: Container

data.caption: Data

user.caption: User
user.description: Describes details about the user that was the target or somehow else associated with the activity that triggered the detection.

evidences.caption: Evidence Artifacts

modified_time.description: The time when the file was last modified.

modified_time_dt.description: The time when the file was last modified.

modifier.caption: Modifier
modifier.description: The user that last modified the file.

name.caption: Name
name.description: The name of the file. For example: svchost.exe

owner.caption: Owner
owner.description: The user that owns the file/object.

parent_folder.description: The parent folder in which the file resides. For example: c:\windows\system32

path.description: The full path to the file. For example: c:\windows\system32\svchost.exe.

product.caption: Product
product.description: The product that created or installed the file.

signature.caption: Digital Signature
signature.description: The digital signature of the file.

size.caption: Size
size.description: The size of data, in bytes.

type.caption: Type
type.description: The file type.

99.caption: Other
99.description: The type is not mapped. See the type attribute, which may contain a data source specific value.

uid.caption: Unique ID
uid.description: The unique identifier of the file as defined by the storage system, such the file system file ID.

url.caption: URL
url.description: The URL where the object resides.

xattributes.caption: Extended Attributes
xattributes.description:
An unordered collection of zero or more name/value pairs where each pair represents a file or folder extended attribute.

For example: Windows alternate data stream attributes (ADS stream name, ADS size, etc.), user-defined or application-defined attributes, ACL, owner, primary group, etc. Examples from DCS:

  • ads_name
  • ads_size
  • dacl
  • owner
  • primary_group
  • link_name - name of the link associated to the file.
  • hard_link_count - the number of links that are associated to the file.

file.caption: File
file.description: The file object describes files, folders, links and mounts, including the reputation information, if applicable.
file.name: file

created_time.description: The time when the finding was created.

desc.caption: Description
desc.description: The description of the reported finding.

supporting_data.description: Additional data supporting a finding as provided by security tool

title.description: The title of the reported finding.

types.caption: Types
types.description: One or more types of the reported finding.

uid.description: The unique identifier of the reported finding.

finding.description: Finding object provides details related to a finding generated by security tool.

analytic.caption: Analytic
analytic.description: The analytic technique used to analyze and derive insights from the data or information that led to the finding or conclusion.

first_seen_time.description:
The time when the finding was first observed. e.g. The time when a vulnerability was first observed.

It can differ from the created_time timestamp, which reflects the time this finding was created.

first_seen_time_dt.caption: First Seen
first_seen_time_dt.description:
The time when the finding was first observed. e.g. The time when a vulnerability was first observed.

It can differ from the created_time timestamp, which reflects the time this finding was created.

last_seen_time.caption: Last Seen
last_seen_time.description:
The time when the finding was most recently observed. e.g. The time when a vulnerability was most recently observed.

It can differ from the modified_time timestamp, which reflects the time this finding was last modified.

last_seen_time_dt.caption: Last Seen
last_seen_time_dt.description:
The time when the finding was most recently observed. e.g. The time when a vulnerability was most recently observed.

It can differ from the modified_time timestamp, which reflects the time this finding was last modified.

modified_time.description: The time when the finding was last modified.

modified_time_dt.caption: Modified Time
modified_time_dt.description: The time when the finding was last modified.

product_uid.description: The unique identifier of the product that reported the finding.

related_events.description: Describes events related to a finding or detection as identified by the security product.

src_url.description: The URL pointing to the source of the finding.

types.description: One or more types of the reported finding.

uid.description: The unique identifier of the reported finding.

algorithm_id.description: The identifier of the normalized hash algorithm, which was used to create the digital fingerprint.

1.caption: MD5
1.description: MD5 message-digest algorithm producing a 128-bit (16-byte) hash value.

2.caption: SHA-1
2.description: Secure Hash Algorithm 1 producing a 160-bit (20-byte) hash value.

3.caption: SHA-256
3.description: Secure Hash Algorithm 2 producing a 256-bit (32-byte) hash value.

4.caption: SHA-512
4.description: Secure Hash Algorithm 2 producing a 512-bit (64-byte) hash value.

5.caption: CTPH
5.description: The ssdeep generated fuzzy checksum. Also known as Context Triggered Piecewise Hash (CTPH).

fingerprint.caption: Fingerprint

The HTTP request method indicates the desired action to be performed for a given resource. Expected values:
  • TRACE
  • CONNECT
  • OPTIONS
  • HEAD
  • DELETE
  • POST
  • PUT
  • GET

phase_id.caption: Kill Chain Phase ID
phase_id.description: The cyber kill chain phase identifier.

0.caption: Unknown
0.description: The kill chain phase is unknown.

1.caption: Reconnaissance
1.description: The attackers pick a target and perform a detailed analysis, start collecting information (email addresses, conferences information, etc.) and evaluate the victims vulnerabilities to determine how to exploit them.

2.caption: Weaponization
2.description: The attackers develop a malware weapon and aim to exploit the discovered vulnerabilities.

3.caption: Delivery
3.description: The intruders will use various tactics, such as phishing, infected USB drives, etc.

4.caption: Exploitation
4.description: The intruders start leveraging vulnerabilities to executed code on the victims system.

5.caption: Installation
5.description: The intruders install malware on the victims system.

6.caption: Command & Control
6.description: Malware opens a command channel to enable the intruders to remotely manipulate the victim's system.

7.caption: Actions on Objectives
7.description: With hands-on keyboard access, intruders accomplish the missions goal.

@deprecated.message: Use specific lat, long attributes instead.

coordinates.caption: Coordinates
coordinates.description: A two-element array, containing a longitude/latitude pair. The format conforms with GeoJSON. For example: [-73.983, 40.719].

country.caption: Country
country.description:
The ISO 3166-1 Alpha-2 country code. For the complete list of country codes see ISO 3166-1 alpha-2 codes.

Note: The two letter country code should be capitalized. For example: US or CA.

desc.caption: Description
desc.description: The description of the geographical location.

geohash.caption: Geohash
geohash.description:
Geohash of the geo-coordinates (latitude and longitude).

Geohashing is a geocoding system used to encode geographic coordinates in decimal degrees, to a single string.

is_on_premises.caption: On Premises
is_on_premises.description: The indication of whether the location is on premises.

isp.caption: ISP
isp.description: The name of the Internet Service Provider (ISP).

lat.caption: Latitude
lat.description: The geographical Latitude coordinate represented in Decimal Degrees (DD). For example: 42.361145.

long.caption: Longitude
long.description: The geographical Longitude coordinate represented in Decimal Degrees (DD). For example: -71.057083.

postal_code.caption: Postal Code
postal_code.description: The postal code of the location.

provider.caption: Provider
provider.description: The provider of the geographical location data.

region.caption: Region
region.description: The alphanumeric code that identifies the principal subdivision (e.g. province or state) of the country. Region codes are defined at ISO 3166-2 and have a limit of three characters. For example, see the region codes for the US.

location.caption: Geo Location
location.description: The location object describes a geographical location, usually associated with an IP address.
location.name: location

device.caption: Device
device.description: The device where the events are logged.

log_level.caption: Log Level
log_level.description: The audit level at which an event was generated.

log_name.caption: Log Name
log_name.description: The event log name. For example, syslog file name or Windows logging subsystem: Security.

log_provider.caption: Log Provider
log_provider.description: The logging provider or logging service that logged the event. For example, Microsoft-Windows-Security-Auditing.

log_version.caption: Log Version
log_version.description: The event log schema version that specifies the format of the original event. For example syslog version or Cisco Log Schema Version.

logged_time.caption: Logged Time
logged_time.description:
The time when the logging system collected and logged the event.

This attribute is distinct from the event time in that event time typically contain the time extracted from the original event. Most of the time, these two times will be different.

logged_time_dt.caption: Logged Time
logged_time_dt.description:
The time when the logging system collected and logged the event.

This attribute is distinct from the event time in that event time typically contain the time extracted from the original event. Most of the time, these two times will be different.

name.caption: Name
name.description: The name of the logging product instance.

product.caption: Product
product.description: The product logging the event.  This may be the event source product, a management server product, a scanning product, a SIEM, etc.

transmit_time.caption: Transmission Time
transmit_time.description: The time when the event was transmitted from the logging device to it's next destination.

transmit_time_dt.caption: Transmission Time
transmit_time_dt.description: The time when the event was transmitted from the logging device to it's next destination.

uid.caption: Unique ID
uid.description: The unique identifier of the logging product instance.

version.caption: Version
version.description: The version of the logging product.

logger.caption: Logger
logger.description: The Logger object represents the device and product where events are stored with times for receipt and transmission.  This may be at the source device where the event occurred, a remote scanning device, intermediate hops, or the ultimate destination.
logger.name: logger

classification_ids.caption: Classification IDs

classifications.caption: Classifications
classifications.description: The list of malware classifications, normalized to the captions of the classifcation_id values. In the case of 'Other', they are defined by the event source.

uid.description: The malware unique identifier, as reported by the detection engine. For example a virus id or an IPS signature id.

malware.description: The malware object describes the classification of known malicious software, which is intentionally designed to cause damage to a computer, server, client, or computer network. A wide variety of malware types exist, including computer viruses, worms, Trojan horses, ransomware, spyware, adware, etc.
malware.name: malware

For example: ["network", "connection.ip:destination", "device.ip:source"]

log_level.description: The audit level at which an event was generated.
